intro: Homognaphalium pulvinatum, commonly known as the silverleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and woolly, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often blooming in spring and summer. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its aromatic leaves and long-lasting flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
